tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: The Doctor spends enough time with each patient, listens to your symptoms, asks the right questions & then shares his diagnosis. Also, doesn't prescribe heavy medication, antibiotics till its absolutely necessary. His staff is extremely helpful, responsive as well. Would highly recommend Dr Shivaram as a GP.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Consulted the doctor via call, as the patient was hesitant to visit any doc. Doctor gave good advices amd explained in detail about the problems of the health. Doc responded in a very polite way, thank tou so much Dr. Shivram.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Good and Great experience with the doctor .Gave appropriate treatment and medication. I recommend other to please visit without worried about anything .Doctor is very friendly and listen your concern and suggest good medication based on your severity.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I have consulted Dr. Shivaram for health issue, he has always been patient and gave enough time to listen to the issue and suggest necessary medications. He has made himself available at anytime to clarify and resolve the queries and concerns even during his busy schedules. He is a very kind, empathetic *** ************* ****** *** a wonderful human. He puts me at ease and makes me smile which is a great medicine itself. Although, I am still being treated, I am sure I can recover soon as the Doctor always encourages me to get better and push myself forward. He has saved my life and will forever be indebted to him. Thanks a ton Doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,
review:
exremely casual approach. The appointment was booked for 9:15 and at 9:13 i get a message from him that i will have to wait for 20 mins. I send him all the issues in the meantime along with the details of the medicines I was prescribed by the practitioner i consulted a day before. He cam online just told his diagnosis and said he will send a prescription and disconnected!

I wanted to tell him the fever situation (which i forgot to send as texts before he came on call) but wasn't even able to call back.

I then texted that as well to him. The medicines he gave did not work and i had to suffer through the extreme throat pain throughout the night.  The next day I again booked another appointment with an ENT ******** ****** ******* *** *** *** ** ********* *** ****** ** *** ***** ** ****** ** **** ****** **** **** ******* ***** ******* **** **** ************ *** *** **** *** ******* ** ** *** * ****** **** *** ***** ** ** ****

tags: None
review: Visited the doctor for annual health checkup consultation and he explained the concerned issue well and  suggested to do new blood check up for few indicators to see if the previous report were inaccurate and said after the report comes I can contact him and he would suggest  medication if needed but the Staff did not connect me to the doctor after receiving the blood report despite calling twice and avoided me saying thier are other patients waiting. Kind of rude and impolite behaviour from the Staff even after speaking kindly and waiting patiently for the response.

tags: None
review: I was given the appointment for 01:45pm and I reached before time with my family. At reception, staff told me to wait and I am in the queue after 2 patients. I waited till 0215pm and staff was eager to send 2 more patients in addition to 2 patients. When I asked, she was not able to help me and were making the things. I had to leave after waiting for 30min without consultation since I had another plan. Staff needs to be more active, should give true information so patients can manage their own schedule accordingly and refrain from unwanted waiting time.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr.Shivaram was very professional, On-time and helpful. Even as I was skeptical about tele consultation, the doctor's approach infused confidence. He asked detailed questions to completely understand the issue and then made accurate diagnosis. We consulted for pain on the right side of the Chest for my 72 year old father. Doctor very patiently heard us and recommended tests and prescribed medicines which brought relief the very next day. My heartfelt thank you for consulting even on a weekend during this terrible pandemic time.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Wait time,Treatment satisfaction,
review: This was my first visit. Had read all the 47 reviews on PRACTO and not a single adverse review was the deciding factor to visit him. Before seeing the reports he asked what all medicines I am taking for different ailments. After that he went through all the different readings and explained in detail what to do and what not. He answered all my queries patiently and prescribed medication for high cholesterol and asked me to come back after 3 months. What I liked the most is his patient listening and clarifying all the doubts. Have seen so called Specialists only taking cursory looks at the reports and also getting irritated if we come out with queries. Have found a very good General Physician and I recommend him wholeheartedly

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: ** ******** ** ** * **** **** ********** He has a kind heart and listens to Patient’s medical issue very patiently. I had seen him on 28th Dec suspecting Covid and he provided me all the necessary information and comfort needed. Since than he had been keeping a close eye on my medical condition and have advised medication as necessary on timely basis. Sometimes he has taken my calls even as late as 11pm in the night also. I would say , we are very fortunate to have a good doctor in our neighborhood in JP Nagar 7 phase. Thank You Doctor and Take Care !! God bless you.....😊

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We have been consulting Dr Sivaram from past 5 years for any sort of medical treatment. ** ** ********* ************* * friendly and patient in explaining the medical conditions. More than anything he boost the confidence and every time we come out after consultation we come out fear and worries free. 

Recent time he treated our entire family for Covid who are in a different location, he was very approachable , supportive and helped us coming out of the situation. He is very detail oriented , one of the reports he was suspecting it’s wrong and asked to redo the test and he was right about the earlier report.

We are very thankful for his availability and support in those tough times and we are glad we found Dr. Sivaram and a no brainier to reach as first person for any sort of medical treatment or advice .

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I have taken online consultation from Dr. Shivaram for my close family members for Coronavirus. Few of them were critical during second wave, and we weren't able to manage Hospital beds. While other doctors suggested hospitalization even when Beds were not available, Dr. Shivaram assured that he will be able to advise medicines to treat the patient at home and it worked. This helped me develop confidence in Dr. Shivaram and now I always refer him or take his second opinion for my family and friends.

tags: Wait time,Doctor friendliness,
review:
When we reached the clinic at 7:30pm, there were at least 20 people waiting for check up with no seats available to sit. When I approached the receptionist, she said I would have to wait at least half an hour despite having a confirmed booking! When I said there's no space to sit for my elderly mother who is 60 years of age, she said you will have to adjust and sit. My question here is why are they accepting other bookings at our reserved time? Why do we have to wait? Also, how can my mother stand for hours waiting for her turn despite having a confirmed booking? 

When I asked the receptionist, can we come tomorrow at 7:45pm with a confirmed booking, she said it will be the same tomorrow as well. That goes to show, they are not following your policies. Please take severe a tion against the concerned.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I got treated for cold first time. But I felt feverish even after taking antibiotics. When I went again, he prescribed for a blood test checking for dengue,typhoid and malaria which cost Rs 3000. The result was nil and he again prescribed high dose antibiotics now... Same thing happened to my husband also... ** * *** ***** *** **** ******* ******* ** **** *** ** ***** ** **** ********** **** ****** ******* Offlate it’s getting expensive for a simple fever too...
reply_text:
Dear Mrs.Bharath,

Fever, cold, chills and body ache are external manifestations of several underlying diseases. All these signs and symptoms are commonly seen in Dengue, Malaria and typhoid. A blood test is the most confirmative investigation to detect the underlying cause. As such the blood investigations advised to you were necessary to rule out these serious infections.
In my tenure as a Medical Consultant with the World Health Organization, I have observed that Dengue, Malaria and typhoid are an endemic in India. There is an alarming rise of dengue cases in Bangalore with one third of the Karnataka’s dengue cases being reported from our city.  India accounts for 75% of all the Malaria cases in South East Asia. Sadly most of the deaths occurring due to these diseases can be attributed to late diagnosis and its complications. 
As such a fever should never be taken lightly, an early detection and early treatment intervention saves you from further complications. As the old saying goes “A stitch in time saves Nine”.
Of 642 suspects with fever and body pain i send for dengue in last 1 year-157 cases turned positive.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Shivaram is an amazing doctor who listens to patient fully and patiently and encourages to be open.  He is completely evidence based in his diagnosis and may ask for additional tests if he suspects other ailments or complications.  Once he confirms his diagnosis, his prescriptions are very precise and just what is needed.  He has a fantastic patient communication ethic.  He will respond 100% to every single message throughout the duration of treatment.  He is alert about any side effects and effectiveness of anything in he has prescribed, and advices accordingly if any arise. Based on his assessment of whether your case is an emergency or not his responses are timed. For non emergency cases response may be delayed, but responds 100% even if very late in the night.  He has earned another permanent patient in me and I will trust only Dr Shivaram for the rest of my life.

He is a doctor who just doesn't go by books, he analyses the symptoms and treats accordingly. Without a doubt I will reach out to him again and I strongly recommend this doctor.
